message: I've found myself finding tons of useful stuff on Quora lately, and would be really grateful if anyone here has, and is willing to part with a Quora invite. Thanks. Feel free to message me here in Convore.
Gimme your email ;)
@ccarnino Wow, how many invitations do you have? :)
Message me your e-mail and I'll send an invite.
yes I have few invites. but without email I can't invite
Could I have one too? I didn't try Quora yet ether. thx
Do you still need invites? I was curious about this, so I just went to Quora's site and it let might sign up right away.

@mediumBlack - I just logged out and tried the Sign Up link in both the header & footer. I'm getting the same message: "Sorry, you must have an invitation to create an account on Quora.". They're probably rolling it out slowly and haven't gotten around to whichever segment I'm in

Hey Guys. Thanks so much for wanting to help me out. I was able to get an Invite. My profile is here should anyone want to follow: http://www.quora.com/Ray-Dookie. I'm willing to return the favor to anyone who wants one. Msg me and let me know.

I can confirm that Quora doesn't require an invite anymore. There's a signup link in the footer, and a couple of weeks ago you also had signups available when visiting user pages... I think they rolled it out slowly undercover :)
I signed up on Quora without an invite 2 weeks ago..
Maybe they locked it down recently?
It might be a zoning thing where you require an invite depending on where you are signing up from. I had to send a friend an invite recently and he figured that was the case.
Def a zoning thing, just tried to sign up from Mexico and I couldn't. But I actually saw a valid sign up page through a VPN in the US :/
That's definitely odd. I guess I should consider myself lucky that I was able to just type in their address and sign up.

It its a geographic rollout. According to the link below, it seems that US, UK, Canada and Sweden do not require an invite. Which explains why, when I was trying to signup from Trinidad & Tobago, I needed an invite. See link: http://www.quora.com/Why-has-Quora-gone-back-to-invite-only-access-recently-Jan-2011
also off topic: Looks like it's down right now.
#off_topic: i cant seem to differentiate between Quora and StackOverflow.. how do i decide when to use which?
@amiamirul http://meta.stackoverflow.com/questions/44618/what-can-we-learn-from-quora has Jeff Atwood thoughts on the difference.
@CrowderSoup It is due to the Amazon AWS Problems. http://justinsb.posterous.com/aws-down-why-the-sky-is-falling

@jeffeffendi This was linked earlier in the conversation: http://www.quora.com/Why-has-Quora-gone-back-to-invite-only-access-recently-January-2011
I live in Australia and I joined Quora only a month and a half ago without an invite. I'm not sure what's up with that, but that's been my experience so far.

@jeffeffendi it is country specific. Started out with the SV, then the rest of the States, and now it is swapping over the world, one country at a time (or so). AFAIR there was a huge influx in non English speaking users around Dec which caused some resentment as they posted in their native language which was not welcomed.
I suppose broken English would degrade the quality of answers and increase the signal-t-noise ratio of replies. Interested to see how they crack that problem...

So far the community police works quite well, maybe too well sometimes. I also believe that they run heavy semantic analysis at the backend, which primarily works with an English corpus, which was another reason for English only.
yeah, but if they went global some day it'd be great moment to verify wikipedia's dominance.
